title: How Harrowing was Mishandled imo
body: I love the harrowing and i look forward to it every year for Halloween. I understand that worlds happened to fall very close to Halloween so you would want to put off the harrowing so as to give it its due without being distracted by worlds but, you chose to release the harrowing story without any harrowing content. this i feel was a bad choice. I liked the bilgewater content you guys released this year, it was thought out and kept us coming back for more and i had hope that the harrowing would tie into that with the same kind of events but instead you released the harrowing story with nothing to back it up and it feels like the harrowing got done as a after thought to worlds.

replies.body: That's also the problem, October is done and we didn't even got the past Harrowing skins. I'm pretty sure 99% of players would have prefered the content, over the story, lore thingy
there is still a chance that we will still get the past skins when the new ones are released, i agree with the october should be when they come out sentiment but you keep your fingers crossed

I Agree Fully

I agree with this completely. i understand as well that World's is extremely important and the two events competing with one another would only cause the two to compete.
But still, my friends and I expected SOMETHING, anything.
If anything, for it to be an almost "count-down" to Halloween with the final content. Or even the skins and map edited to Hallow's glory, being released on the day of or towards the evening. I understand most would have probably hated this due to having to assist in the Halloween revelry via siblings or family in general. But it would have felt so amazing and fit so well to fall in place like that. Like it had some relevance to the spooky nature of the holiday itself.  I for one am a HUGE fan of Bilgewater and couldn't stop playing the mode and reading the story as it came; the icons tied to it only made it better!
I even waited for the updates to the story, which I don't do often with the lore of games. 
As Halloween passed it really was a huge let down and my friends and I were left wondering "what just happened? did we miss something? Where was the build up and satisfaction?" Maybe I'm just being nerdy here. But i know I'm not alone. I'm not berating and am certainly not trying to complain. But please just give us something here; with so many other games doing something to lead up to Halloween and you guys stating that you wanted it to be similar to Bilgewater, I guess we just expected more.

I'm gonna be frank here, every year I have played, The Harrowing and Showdown have been bigger and bigger letdowns.
